projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_idListMembers_v01.xml file.

div.head: Plate 1 (WM-49508), Recto
div.p:
// svasti śakavarṣātīta 825 phālguṇa-māsa tithi pratipada kr̥ṣṇa, vurukuṁ, vāgai, soma, vāra, hastā-nakṣatra vr̥ddhi-yo-
ga, tatkāla Anugraha śrī mahārāja rakai vatu kura dyaḥ balituṁ śrī dharmodayamahāśambhu tumurun· I rakryān· mapatiḥ
I hino pu dakṣottamabāhubajrapratipakṣakṣaya kumon· samgat· kalaṁ vuṅkal· pu layaṁ, Anak vanuA I patapān· tutu-
ganniṁ taṇḍa sumusuka Ikanaṁ vanuA I vukajana I tumpak· I vuru tlu vatak· kalaṁ vuṅkal· gavai mā 6 savaḥ kahadyanan· ta-
mpaḥ 8 6 akṣ.I'm not sure what could possibly go here. The only remaining unit of area left unmentioned is lamvit, but even if there were two digits after it, it would still not make 6 akṣaras blaḥ 1 suku 1 kaṭik· prāṇa 2 akṣ.vurnya hinavu-havu, samvandhānya kinon· sumusuka Ikanaṁ vanuA vuA-
ra kuṭi _ 6 akṣ. vatak· husaḍar· ya ta pinu_liḥ samgat· kalaṁ vuṅkal·, pinahayunira jinaryyakan·nira bihāra
ya samvandhānyar· Inanugrahān· kinon sumusuka Ikanaṁ vanuA I vukajana I tumpak· I vuru tlu sīmā pu_mpunananikanaṁ vi-
hāra gavai_nira kunaṁ parṇnaḥhanyan· sīmā tan· katamāna de saṁ mānak· paṅkur· tavān· tiri_p· muAṁ soAra_niṁ maṅilala dra-
bya haji kriṁ, paḍam·, pamaṇikan·, maṇiga, lva, malañja, maṁhuri, makalaṅka, tapa haji Air haji maṁrumvai tuha gośāli tuhan na-
mbi tuhān· hañjaman·, Uṇḍahagi maṇimpiki paṇḍai vsi valyan·, paranakan·, vidu maṅiduṁ, tuha paḍahi varahan·, samval·

div.head: Plate 1 (WM-49508), Verso
div.p:
sumvul·, vatək· I dalam·, siṅgaḥ, pamr̥ṣi, hulun· haji Ityaivamādi tan· tumamā Irikanaṁ vanuA parṇahani parmasanya tumamā
I bhaṭāra I vihāra I dalinan· deyanya mavaiḥ mana/ṅa\hana I parmasan· I kataṇḍān·, samaṅkana sukha-duḥkhanya mayaṁ tan· mavuAḥ ḍa-
ṇḍa, kuḍaṇḍa bhaṇḍihalādi tumamā I bhaṭāra Ataḥ Ikana, Ājñă haji kinonakan· Ikanaṁ masamvyavahāra Aṅkāna hīṁ-hīṁṅana kvaiḥ-
hanya paṇḍai mas·, paṇḍai vsi, tamvaga, gaṅsa, tluṁ Ububan· Iṁ sasīma macadar· 4 maṅaraḥ lumpaṁ 3 maṅulaṁ tluṁ tuhān· Iṁ sasīma kvoAnya 20
Iṁ satuhān·, sapi 40 vḍus· 80 Aṇḍaḥ vantayan· 1 parahuA bhaṭāra@jarrah.sastrawan@gmail.comIn relation to the parallel passage in Muncang Sindok, 866 Śaka, where we read about padagaṅ bhaṭāra "deity traders",I now see two possibilities for interpreting this:1. split parahuA bhaṭāra 1 "may have one deity vessel"2. keep the current word division and interpret abhaṭāra with reference to OJED *mahyaṅ* 'having an inhabiting protectingdeity'In both cases, I think the meaning is a vessel used for trade on behalf of the temple.What say you?_Assigned to Jarrah Sastrawan_unless we take option 1, the difference between abhaṭāra in parahu abhaṭāra and bhaṭāra in padagaṅ bhaṭāra still needs to be explained...I think option 1 is the way to go, because the other two terms masuṅhara and patuṇḍāna are also irrealis. I don't know why irrealis is being used for this list only, and not the previous or following onesI am not sure you are right that masunghara nad patundana are irrealis. cf. Telang I
parahu 1 suṁharanya 3 tan· patuṇḍāna. But you are right to pose the question why this part of this list would be in irrealis and not what surrounds it. Unforntitaley tinulad, but still of some relevance: Sobhamerta 4r2–3 I vnaṅa mpuṅku mapadagaṅa, Aṁrva taraju, maparahva rvaṁ siki, Amutər·, 2 siki, Aṁlampit·, Aṅavari, ...Can you write out a bit of commmenarty on the problem? 1 masuṁhara 1 tan· patuṇḍāna, maguluṅan· tluṁ pasaṁ Ikanaṁ samaṅkana ta-
n· knāna I paramasan· yāpuAn· pinikul· dagaṅanya kady āṅgāniṁ mabasana masayaṁ makacapuri, kapas· vuṅkuḍu tamvaga vsi 3 akṣ. vəAs·, 4 akṣ.
ca. 8 akṣ. saprakāraniṁ duAl· pinikul·, kalima bantal· Iṁ satuhān· pikul-pikulananya, tluṁ tuhān· Iṁ sasīma, Ikanaṁ samaṅkana tan· knā-
na de saṁ maṅilala drabya haji, yāpuAn· lviḥ kvaiḥnya saṅkā Irikanaṁ maṁhīṁ Iriya, knāna Ikana sakalviḥnya de saṁ maṅilala soddhāra haji, kunaṁ
Ikanaṁ mañamvul·, mañavriṁ maṅapus·, maṁlākha, Uṇḍahagi, mamuvut·, maṅubar·, manahab· manuk·, mamisaṇḍuṁ, maṅanam-anam·, mamukat· vuṅkuḍu
manarub· _ maṁdyūn· maṅgula maṁhapū, Ityaivamādi kapuA ya tribhāgān· sadūman· Umarā I bhaṭāra sadūman· Umarā I saṁ maṅilala drabya haji
sadūman· Umarā I saṁ makmitan· sīma, maṅkana rasa saṁ hyaṁ Ājña haji,this restoration to be reconsidered, see Telang II
paṁhiṁ-hiṁ I rikanaṁ ca. 30 akṣ.
3 akṣ. śrī mahārāja ca. 9 akṣ. ma ca. 6 akṣ. su 1 3 akṣ. hu ca. 6 akṣ.n· Cu tamv. ca. 8 akṣ kalyā-

div.head: Plate 2 (WM-49506), Recto
div.p:
ga blaḥ 1The parallel passage in Sangsang 1v7 has jagā yu 1 which seem to be an error for kalyāga yu 1. It seems impossible to reads yu here, though blaḥ does not seem to fit the context... mas· su 1 rakryān· mapatiḥ I hino InaṁsəAn· vḍihan· kalyāga yu 1 mas· su 1 rakryān· I halu pu vīravikrama InaṁsəAn· vḍihan· kalyā-
ga yu 1 mas· su 1 samgat· halaran· pu basupalar· hyaṁ pu puñjaṁ maṁhuri pu cakra vadihati pu ḍapit·, makudur· pu samvr̥da, paṅkur· pu rañjan· tavān· pu pañja-
luAn· tirip· pu biṣṇu, vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 8 sovaṁ-sovaṁ tuhān· I vadihati 2 saṁ _ mira_-mirah si rayuṁ saṁ halaran· si dhana-
da vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 ma_s· mā 4 tuhān· I makudur· 2 saṁ taṅkil· sugiḥ si mantai, saṁ this guy not found elsewhere in Balitung corpus, but found several times in Sindok corpus si ḍuha vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 4 soAṁ, I vadihati lu-
maku manusuk· saṁ vaḍiṅin· si vada humacf. Panggumulan A 2v14-15 and Harinjing A A16 vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 8 hop· paṅaṅkat·, _ I makudur· lumaku manusuk· saṁ pahvan· vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 2
mas· mā 8 hop· paṅaṅkat·, paṅaṅkat· I saṁ hyaṁ kudur· vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 4 saṁ mamuAt· parujar· I hino saṁ kaṇḍamuhi si haṅgə@arlo.cik@gmail.com We very much expect tuṅgaṁ here, as this is the name of this official throughout the Balitung period. I can just about convince myself to read tuṅgəṁ on the corroded plate – can you?_Assigned to Arlo Griffiths_indeed I can! thanks! please make the change. can you also make it in the xml file? citralekha saṁ vatu vara-
ṇi si manəsər·, I halu saṁ viśaga si dāmodara, I sirikan· si hujuṁ galuḥ si Ayuda, citralekha saṁ dharmmāsinta 8 akṣ. vidiḥ si ḍaṇu
citralekha saṁ halaṁ manuk· si govinda, I tiruAn· sumuḍan· ḍapunta bhāsura vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 5 soAṁ-soAṁ 6 akṣ. savi ma-
nuk· 1 akṣ. vijanta I maṅhuri 4 akṣ. pa_daya I paṅkur· dədəlan· si ma3 akṣ. I tavān· rāluk· si vidyādipa, I tirip· paḍaṁ si raghu vinaiḥ vḍihan·
yu 1 mas· mā 2 soAṁ-soAṁ I 15 akṣ. si laṅka panavuṅan· si kampa 14 akṣ.
3 akṣ. tuhānniṁ kanāyakān· 3/4 akṣ.· samo 8 akṣ. na 7 akṣ.sl· si śāla, tuhānni vadvā 5 akṣ. tuhānni kalu-
la si hva 1 akṣ. parujar· si 2 akṣ. tu_hānni 2 akṣ.la 7 akṣ. si 2 akṣ.ṅga 1 akṣ. mamasaṅakan· pu rutu, citralekha saṁ saśra 2 akṣ.Aṅinn-a-

div.head: Plate 2 (WM-49506), Verso
div.p:
ṅin· si basu, tuhādimagala, si sāgara, patiya si təvək· 12 akṣ. Cu 3 akṣ. pasak-pasak· kaharan· maparaha Iri-
kā kabaiḥ ya Ikanaṁ pinakaUbhayanya paṅanumodanya I 8 akṣ. samgat· kalaṁ vuṅkal· mapatiḥ I kalaṁ vuṅkal·
kin·kin· si manūrama si śaṇḍi manti hyaṁ si ke_s· rama_ni tiṅkat· vinaiḥ vḍihan· savayakḍyan· yu 1 mas· mā 4 soAṁ-soAṁ parujarnya si ma-
ṇḍa ramani nalu, muAṁ si kaluAt· ra_mani galu vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 4 akṣ. va_huta Ikana duṅkut· kuyu mavərav· si gijī
lakan· si bahu vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 mas· mā 4 soAṁ-soAṁ piluṅganya prāṇa 4 si dhanadya si mumpaor maybe muṣya? si dhuragaḥ si bisuddhi vinaiḥ vḍihan·
hle 1 mas· mā 1 so_Aṁ-soAṁ vahuta tuṅgū duruṁ si naṅas· muAṁ si ma_ddhya vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ pihujuṁnya prāṇa 5
si mera si2 akṣ. gi 2 akṣ. si blasaṇḍa si śvarā si kura si bahad· si nāṇḍal· vinaiḥ vḍihan· hle 1 soAṁ-soAṁ patiḥ I hinau Umilu
sākṣī tarumvajaor vasumbaja? vasumvaja? cf. kasumba, vaja in Nganjatan?tarumvajaṁ in Poh 2r6 siri candra ramani bilahiraor bilahiri? si vadvā pora ramani śu_lī si kayi rama_ni panusi vinaiḥ vḍihan· kalyāga yu 1 soAṁ
patiḥ I halu pās· si dunuṁ ramani candrikā, vuṅkuruṅan· si gvaṁ ramani sādhana, vinaiḥ vḍihan· kalyāga yu 1 soAṁ, patiḥ I gurun vaṅi Ai-
r hijo si lampū ramani go, havaṅan· si ma_ṇi ramaṇi kamvū vinaiḥ vḍihan· savayakḍyan· yu 1 soAṁ parujarnya si kalula ramani cintyā
muaṁ si R̥ṅuci ramani nampik· vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ, patiḥ panavuhan·or read pandavutan·? si vuyo ramani Aṇṭuk· vinaiḥ vḍihan·
yu 1 vahuta I gurun vaṅi mantyāsiḥ si ḍaṁhəl· vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 saṁ rama I duga-duga gusti saṁ ra vunut· ra_mani mpirarat· gusti lā-

div.head: Plate 4 (TM-856-2), Recto
div.p:
mapkan· si tuvuku parujar· si sidra si malavai si basanta vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ rāma maratā kaki kuṇḍu muAṁ si vlya vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ rāma māgman· I vuru tlu gusti
si mandon· ramani rasuk· parujar· si ḍaheṁ ramani kaṇṭi vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ gusti I tumpak· si gaṅgaṁ rama_ni baladī parujar· si laṇḍu ramani bhaṇḍa vinaiḥ vḍihan·
yu 1 soAṁ gusti I vukajana si butə ramani bantin·, paru_jar· si gamana ramani krama vinaiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ rakryān· Añjatan· pu sāgara sa_mgat· tuṅgu pu 2 akṣ. vinaiḥ vḍiha-
n· yu 1 soAṁ rāma tpi siriṁ gusti I dalinan· si kekeḥ ramani dvī, muAṁ si vlat·, parujar· si gaṇal· ramani savasti muAṁ si hala ramani ṅvinə vineḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ
I mahariman· kalaṁ si knoḥ ramani santəl· gusti si puñjə ramani padmī, muAṁ si śarak· ramani gaṭik·, parujar· si deśi ramani rakṣi muAṁ si śaraṇa rāma I kisik· vi-
naiḥ vḍihan· yu 1 soAṁ, I huvus·niṅ mavaiḥ mas· pa_sak-pasa_k· muAṁ vḍihan· pinarṇaḥ saji saṁ makudur· maṅuyut· vḍihan· saṁ hyaṁ kulumpaṁ yu 4 batu-batu
mas· mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 saṁ hyaṁ brahmā yu 1 mas· mā 1 paṅisi tamvakur· pinakasavur-savur· saṁ maṅuyut· vəA_s· kukusan· 1 vsi Ikat· 1 mas· mā 4 pa-
da 1 vsinya Ikat· 10 mas· mā 1 vḍus· 1 hayam· lanaṁ hiR̥ṁ 1 hantalūniṁ hayam· 4 taṇḍas·niṁ kvo 1 kumol· 1 pras· masuku 1 skul· dinyun· 5 ta-
luṁ tapak· liman· 10 pasiliḥ galuḥ yu 1 *Arghapādya Iṇḍit· 5 tamvata prakāra kavaḥ 1 dyun· 1 dāṁ 1 buri 1 paṁlivəttan· 1 tarai 1 also in Bhatari, Rukam, Poh
1 saragi cpak· 1 gaṁśa prakāra saragi magə:ṁ 1 tahas· 1 saragi Inuman· 3 vsi-vsi prakāra vaduṁ 1 patuk·-patuk· 1 tvak· 1 tampilan· 1 kris· 1 lukai 1 kampi-
t· 1 tataḥ 1 jara 1 gurumbhāgi 1 pamajjha 1 nakhaccheda l gulu_mi l siku-siku 1 liṅgis· 4 laṇḍuk· 1 I sampuni saji saṁ maṅuyut· pinarṇaḥ maṁḍiri samgat· kalaṁ vu-
ṅkal· muAṁ samgat· Anakbi dyaḥ sucintə muAṁ dyaḥ kina dyaḥ vaitā dyaḥ savitā, mavaiḥ pañco_pacāra I saṁ ma_muAt· Ujar·, tlas· saṁ mamuAt· Ujar· vinaiḥ pa-
ñcopacāra maskar· sira majnu, mapaṅaliḥ maṁḍiri dumunuṁ Iṁ vitāna paṅuyutan· maluṅguḥ humaR̥p· kidul· humarapakan· saṁ hyaṁ kudur· saṁ vahuta hyaṁ kudur· malu-
ṅguḥ humaR̥p· vaitan·, samaṅkana saṁ patiḥ vahuta maluṅguḥ I puṁku_ran· saṁ vahuta hyaṁ kudur·, Ikanaṁ rāma I vukajana I tumpak·I vu_ru tlu muAṁ

div.head: Plate 4 (TM-856-2), Verso
div.p:
rāma tpi siriṁ kabaiḥ maluṁguḥ humaR̥p· lor· raiṇanta Umuṅguḥ vaitanniṁ vitāna humaR̥m· kuluAn·, samāpta paluṅguḥnira kabaiḥ mamaṁmaṁ saṁ makudu- r· manətək· hayam· linaṇḍasakan· I saṁ hyaṁ kulumpaṁ mamantiṅakan· hantalū riṁ vatu sīma, matəhər· manapatai Ika_na līṁnira Īndaḥ kita saṁ hyaṁ sahana- nta saṁ malmaḥ saṁ mathāni, sakvaiḥta hyaṁ riṁ pūrba, dakṣiṇa, paścima, Uttara, Āgnaiya, nairiti, bāyabya, Aiśānya, saṁ hyaṁ riṁ satyadharmma, kāla, mr̥tyu, krodha, vīśva, kā- ma, viṣṇu, Iṁ maddhya, I sor·, I ruhur·, tasmāt· kabuAt·-karmānikanaṁ vuAṁ Anyāya Umulah-ulaha Ikeṁ sīma samgat· kalaṁ vuṅkal· pu layaṁ ṅunivaiḥ ya- n· ruddhā ya tan· tamuA phalaniṁ dadi kady aṅgānnikanaṁ hayam· pgat· tan· baluy· matpuṁ hantalū R̥mək·-R̥muk· tan· valuy· I luĪrnya maṅkanā Ikanaṁ vu- Aṁ durācāra yan ulah-ulaha Ikaiṁ sīma, Umarā ya riṁ Alas· patukanniṅ ulā, Umarā ya Iṁ tgal· Alapann i glap·, tan· pahudan·, Umarā ya riṅ uAi viL̥ttan·- n i tuviran·, tətəkən· deniṁ vuIl·, piṁpiṁtubimvān· pañcamahāpātaka paṅguhanya mataṅ ya kayatnākna Ikeṁ Ājñă haji paṅanugraha śrī mahārā- ja rakai vatu kura I samgat· kalaṁ vuṅkal· pu layaṁ sumusuka Ikanaṁ vanuA I vukajana I tumpak· I vuru tlu sīmā pumpunananikanaṁ bihāra I dalinnan· gavainira makaphalā svasthā saṁ hyaṁ dharma muAṁ prajāḥ-śaḥ not possible? kabaiḥ kahlamanya hinyūnnakan· ton-tonan·Andrea in "Birds Bards Buffoons and Brahmans" discusses the interpretation of this passage, worth noting 2014: 22-23, esp. n. 39. Also similar terms appear in Sumanasāntaka 113.1-9 mamidu saṁ ta_ṅkil· hyaṁ si nalu macarittamacarita is repeated three times, in each case connected in reference to a narrative. This makes me think that 'carita' means something similar to Mod Jav. 'lakon', which is of course one of its Skt. meanings. So rather than 'recitation' viz. a type of performance, I think here it may refer to the narrative plot of each type of performance igal macarita X, pirus macarita Y, vayaṅ macarita Z. This use of 'macarita' is also found in relation to griṅsiṅ textiles, though only in Middle Jav texts bhiṣmma kumāraMBh01,122.021c brāhmaṇasya vacas tathyaṃ tac ca karmaviśeṣavat
01,122.022a bhīṣmaḥ śrutvā kumārāṇāṃ droṇaṃ taṃ pratyajānata
HCtasya ca sugṛhītanāmno devasya devyāṃ śyāmādevyāṃ bhāskaradyutirbhāskaravarmāparanāmā tanayaḥ saṃtanorbāgīrathyāṃ bhīṣma iva kumāraḥ samabhavat /
The akṣara still looks more like m than ṣ to me - are there no references to Bhīma kumara in Skt.?Also Supomo 1995: 323: "Apart from singing mamidu, dancingmangigal, a Kicaka dance, play-acting mamirus and clowning mabañol,the inscription also mentions a wayang performance mawayang of the storyof “Bhīmaya-kumara”, and a recital macarita of the “Bhīma-kumara” and“Rāmāyaṇa” stories. Both “Kicaka” and the “Bhīma-kumara” obviously refer toa certain episode from the Wirā ṭaparwa, the fourth book of the MahābhārataZoetmulder 1974:208-209."Jiří talks about representations of Kīcaka in a 2012? paper "Swarming ants and their kin in the Old Javanese kakawin" pp. 58-61.I'm increasingly persuaded by Zoetmulder's claim that this specifically refers to the passage in the Virāṭaparva where Bhīma kills Kīcaka section IV in Juuynboll's ed. maṅigal· kīca- ka si jaluk· macarita rāmāyaṇa mamirus· mabañol· si mu_k·muk·More bio details of this guy in Lintakan : huler si muk·-muk· ramani ṇdokoḥ, si galigī mavayaṁ buAt thyaṁ macarita bimva ya kumāra, matəhər· maṁhyunnakan· sa- 1 akṣ.ṁ kapuA rāmanta tpi siriṁ kabaiḥ māvuran·, Umilu pamuAtoḥpamuAt toḥ?Yes I think it must beI'm starting to think that pamuAtoḥ may be acceptable. There seems to have been a genuine merger of buat toh > bwatoh > botoh happening quite early: we see the form botoh appear in Ramayana 24.123 and in OJO 54 "saṁ juru botoḥ"good point! rakryān· muAṁ makaruṅakan· haji saṁ tr̥pan· pu mitra, muAṁ pu malavaṁ huL̥_s· Umi-

app.note: the usual double daṇḍa with curl
the reading is supported by the occurrence of the same words in Kinewu, line 5.
maybe huvusan·, as in Telang REF?
or read soĀra_niṁ?

app.lem: I bhaṭāra I vihāra I dalinan· deyanya mavaiḥ mana/ṅa\hana I parmasan·
app.note: readings and restorations established by comparison with Sangsang 1r10–11 and Wukajana II 1v8

this may be the earliest attestation of this word. The spelling, with bh or m, cannot be ascertained, but it seems the former predominates in the records of the Sindok period, while the latter comes into vogue later. On this basis, I restore bh

app.lem: hīṁ-hīṁṅana kvaiḥhanya paṇḍai mas·, paṇḍai vsi,
app.note: restored after the parallel in Sangsang 1r12

app.lem: Ikanaṁ mañamvul·, mañavriṁ maṅapus·, maṁlākha, Uṇḍahagi
app.note: the lacunae are filled by comparison with Sangsang 1v4

app.lem: sadūman· Umarā I saṁ makmitan· sīma, maṅkana rasa saṁ hyaṁ Ājña haji
app.note: the lacuna is filled by comparison with Sangsang 1v6, although the word rasa saṁ hyaṁ are not found there; we need them to accommodate the visible anusvāra, and find them in Anjatan r10. The resulting number of restored akṣaras, however, is considerably higher than the number of akṣaras in the corresponding space in line 1v10, so the restoration is somewhat uncertain

restore after Sangsang 1v6–7 masamvyavahāra hana ṅkāna maṅasəAkan· samgat· lamva pasamvaḥ I? But the correspondence of this passage between the two inscriptions does not seem to have been sufficiently precise anymore to warrant relying only on the parallel
Comparison with Sangsang 1v7 shows that our text must have been considerably more extensive, but almost nothing is readable of this line
Sangsang 1v7 vḍihan· jagā yu 1 mas· su l mā 4

app.lem: si rayuṁ saṁ halaran· si dhanada
app.rdg: saṁ rayuṁ saṁ halaran· saṁ dhanada
app.note: corr.
an alternative reading night be saṁ mamuAt· Inujar·. Either way, the text may have to be corrected to saṁ mamuAt· Ujar·, as in Wukajana II 1r12.

Much of these lines is extremely worn or totally lost. The readings has been established by comparison with a passage in Wanua Tengah III 2r13–14 where many of same terms occur: citralekha halaṁ manuk· ḍa punta vuru tuk·, I tiruAn· sumuḍan· ḍa punta bhāsura, parujar· I halaran· savi manuk· pu dharmma, I palar· hyaṁ rumakat· pu baka, I jalinan· ra varyyaṁ saṁ mudgalyāna, I maṁhuri raruI·, I paṅkur dədəlan·, I tavān· rāluk·, I tirip· paḍaṁ.
norm.
thus vN. The name is difficult to read, but I see rather something like duduku or vurukuṁ
No punctuation sign is visible and none is expected.
The punctuation sign is not clear. It might also be possible to read dvīnə here. Cf. the similar or identical name further on in the line.
It would be equally possible to read dvinə here. Is the similarity with the name earlier in the line coincidental?
No tarung is discernible
corr.
it would also be possible to read tuṇḍas·
Cf. OJED təluṅ? Or guluṅ?
corr.
See OJED s.v. saragi
Cf. occurrences of pamajha in Taji, Poh and Rukam
The barely legible final akṣara seems more likely to be tai

div.p: On the basis of significant correspondences of contents, the two Wereldmuseum plates and the one Amsterdam plate are here assumed to form parts of a single original set, despite small differences of dimensions, absence of any evident connection between the sources of acquisition, and absence of evident continuity of the text between WM-49506 (plate 2) and TM-856-2 (plate 4), which is explained here by postulating loss of a third plate. It is suspected that the three plates, together with the closely related Hujung Galuh or Sangsang plate (TM-856-1), all derive from a single trove (which would have been a kind of monastic archive), that would have become split up either before or after some or all of the plates being transported to the Netherlands and subsequently donated to two Dutch Museums.

listApp.bibl: Aanwinsten op ethnografisch en anthropologisch gebied van de afdeeling Volkenkunde van het Koloniaal Instituut over 1934, Serie 856 Koninklijk Koloniaal Instituut te Amsterdam, Mededeeling N° XXXVI, Afdeeling Volkenkunde N° 7, Amsterdam, 1935, p. 7 (notice).

F. H. van Naerssen, « Transcriptie en vertaling van de opschriften van twee roodkoperen platen. Serie 856 nos. 1 en 2 », Bijlage 1 in Aanwinsten op ethnografisch en anthropologisch gebied van de afdeeling Volkenkunde van het Koloniaal Instituut over 1934 Koninklijk Koloniaal Instituut te Amsterdam, Mededeeling N° XXXVI, Afdeeling Volkenkunde N° 7, Amsterdam 1935, pp. 135–144.

G. Th. Pigeaud, Literature of Java. Catalogue raisonné of Javanese manuscripts in the library of the University of Leiden and other public collections in the Netherlands, vol. II, Leiden : Koninklijk Instituut voor Taal-, Land- en Volkenkunde / The Hague : Martinus Nijhoff, 1968, p. 852.

Tropenmuseum / J.H. van Brakel et al., Budaya Indonesia : kunst en cultuur in Indonesië = arts and crafts in Indonesia, Amsterdam : Koninklijk Instituut voor de Tropen, 1987, p. 93 n° 27 (image à l’inverse de la face B), p. 265 n° 27 (notice).
